name: Location and type of postgraduate activity for U.S. citizen and permanent resident S&E doctorate recipients with definite postgraduate plans, by race and ethnicity: 2017
description: Location and type of postgraduate activity for U.S. citizen and permanent resident S&E doctorate recipients with definite postgraduate plans, by race and ethnicity: 2017

creator.name: National Center for Science and Engineering Statistics

variableMeasured.name: location_and_type_of_activity
variableMeasured.description: Location and type of activity hierarchy

variableMeasured.name: field_not_hispanic_or_latino_american_indian_or_alaska_native
variableMeasured.description: Not Hispanic Or Latino American Indian Or Alaska Native

variableMeasured.name: field_not_hispanic_or_latino_black_or_african_american
variableMeasured.description: Not Hispanic Or Latino Black Or African American

variableMeasured.name: field_not_hispanic_or_latino_more_than_one_race
variableMeasured.description: Not Hispanic Or Latino More Than One Race

variableMeasured.name: field_not_hispanic_or_latino_other_race_or_race_not_reported
variableMeasured.description: Not Hispanic Or Latino Other Race Or Race Not Reported

specialValues.D: suppressed to avoid disclosure of confidential information

notes: Data in this table refer to research doctorates only and differ from doctoral degree data in this report that are based on the Integrated Postsecondary Education Data System Completions Survey. The greatest differences are in psychology, education, and medical or other health sciences. American Indian or Alaska Native doctorate recipients with unknown or refused citizenship status are counted as U.S. citizens and thus are included. Definite postgraduate plans are defined as Returning to, or continuing in, predoctoral employment or Have signed contract or made definite commitment for a "postdoc" or other work by doctoral degree recipients who responded to the question, What is the status of your postgraduate plans (in the next year)? In 2017, 63% of U.S. citizen and permanent resident S&E doctorate recipients had definite plans. Reporting categories for race and ethnicity were expanded in 2013; comparisons to prior-year data should be made with caution.
sources: National Science Foundation, National Center for Science and Engineering Statistics, Survey of Earned Doctorates, 2017.
